intro: Linaria grjunerae var. grjunerae, commonly known as the Grjuner's toadflax, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branched stems covered in fine, hairy hairs. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers with two lips, characteristic of the Plantaginaceae family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
